main event: On August 31, 1957, a brilliant star close to the moon was observed in Palm Springs, California, and was ultimately evaluated as possibly being a balloon or aircraft while also considering astronomical phenomena.
interesting points: The star was described as brighter than the moon with a constant brilliance., The sighting was recorded using GCA radar., The observer had insufficient data to conclude definitively what the object was., The original documentation is part of Project Blue Book's report on unidentified aerial phenomena., A letter from J. Allen Hynek discussed unusual deviations detected by a logistician on a satellite's trajectory.
witness description: Ground visual observation by a military radar specialist.
